Title: Gundam Build Fighters and the Power of Toy Anime - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.              Forum - View topicGundam Build Fighters and the Power of Toy Anime             Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        Rob19ny    Joined: 13 Jun 2020 		    Posts: 964       Posted: Fri Apr 01, 2022 12:07 pm            I knew what I was getting into by watching Build Fighters because this was the period Sunrise had been focusing on children's Gundam with a young MC like in Age before it. I actually held off on watching BF for that reason (until the Try BD's released), but I decided to give it a chance. But it actually took me by surprise. It was really good. So good that I watched Beginning G afterward. First, the music. BACK-ON doing the OP song and it was a banger per usual let me know that BF was one to keep watching. As I kept watching, it just kept getting more interesting, an enjoyable watch if you will. Then BACK-ON does the 2nd OP song again, but this time with Lil' Fang from FAKY. They transcended to another level. At this point, you have to love BF. While Try wasn't better than BF, the OP songs by BACK-ON and EDGE of LIFE (I was surprised BACK-ON didn't do the 2nd OP, but I loved EoL since Fairy Tail, so it was forgiven) kept the same feeling BF's songs had.   Second, the dual protagonist of Reiji and Sei reminded me of Yami Yugi and Yugi as I kept watching. One takes the backseat to work on the Gunpla while the other does the battling. As stated in chapter 40 something of the Yugioh manga, Yami Yugi and Yugi are two sides of the same coin. Reiji and Sei fit this even though they are not in the same body.   Third, Meiji Kawaguchi. He's so cool. Nuff said.   While I loved BF, the one thing I felt it lacked was waifu's. Sure, there's best girl Aila, but that's it. Rinko is a mother and married (a MILF if you will), and the funny thing is that due to the lack of waifu's, Rinko ends up being the one with the most fan art and doujins. Try improves on this by adding more waifu's. Fumina obviously ends up being the most popular (even Sunrise knows this by making figures of her), then there's Mirai, and Lady Kawaguchi. Heck, even Kaoruko is popular.   BF is best Build series.     Quote:    The protagonist Sei Iori hopes to be a legendary Gunpla battler like his father, but while he is an expert at creating and customizing Gunpla, he's not so great at controlling them. Suddenly, a boy named Reiji mysteriously            Just letting folks know that Reiji and Sei share the role of MC.      Back to top                  Nyren    Joined: 07 Oct 2014 		    Posts: 663       Posted: Fri Apr 01, 2022 4:50 pm            I can straight up say that if you thought there was anything special about Sekai, there isn't. His design is just similar to Reiji. If you watched Island Wars, then you know the character that's actually connected to Reiji. GM's Counterattack provided some much needed closure for Season One, it's just a shame that it came so far after. But I do agree that Try, while not as good as the first season, did tease a third season with a lot of promise for even more payoff. Sadly, we got Divers instead, and it seems they intend to keep doing Divers for now, which is a shame because it's not as good. Re:Rise was a vast improvement over the first Divers, but it still paled in comparison to Build Fighters to me. That being said it's obvious where Bandai's inspiration for their Gundam Metaverse idea came from and that's an idea that they've been cooking for a while now.      Back to top                  SpiritSmoocher    Joined: 06 Mar 2021 		    Posts: 154       Posted: Fri Apr 01, 2022 5:14 pm            Speaking of Yugioh, Konami has done far better than Bandai has in the west. In the TCG and gacha community, Bandai is often referred to as one of the worst companies to handle gaming.      Back to top                  BlueAlf    Joined: 02 Jan 2017 		    Posts: 1152       Posted: Fri Apr 01, 2022 9:29 pm            tl;dr  Gundam Build Fighters was really good.  Gundam Build Fighters Try was good, but not as good as the original GBF.   Gundam Build Divers was really disappointing.   Gundam Build Divers Re: Rise was better than GBD, but still not as good as GBF.      Back to top                  SpiritSmoocher    Joined: 06 Mar 2021 		    Posts: 154       Posted: Fri Apr 01, 2022 10:41 pm            We all know gundam and gunpla is barely a thing in the west vs yugioh   In the 2000s, bandai flooded thousands of card stores with card games that would die left and run. This caused many card shops to go under. A lot of store owners and distributors in the west hate bandai with a burning passion. Bandai was so incompetent at tcgs, they killed the naruto tcg at narutos peak popularity. If you go to any tcg forum in the west and think bandai is doing okay with, you will be mocked ruthlessly.      Back to top                  TranceLimit174    Joined: 21 Jul 2004 		    Posts: 918       Posted: Sun Apr 03, 2022 12:43 pm              Nyren wrote:    I can straight up say that if you thought there was anything special about Sekai, there isn't. His design is just similar to Reiji.            What's special about Sekai, and the reason to like him, is his connection to Domon. It's paper thin yes, but it's enough to make G Gundam fans happy.   I agree that Try isn't as good as the original GBF, but it still has some great episodes like the one where Sekai gets thrashed by a raw build Gunpla (no painting, etc.).   I didn't bother with Divers or Re:Rise, and it sounds like there isn't much reason to. But that said, what makes GBF great is how enthusiastic and shameless it is about being what it is: a toy commercial. Interest Anime/Manga/Game Industry Celebrates April Fool's Day 2022   posted on 2022-04-02 00:45 UTC-8 by Kim Morrissy         Roundup of joke announcements from Made in Abyss, Love Live!, Shadows House, Kaguya-sama, more    It's that time of the year again: the cherry blossoms fall, and the April Fool's pranks fly. Japan's anime, manga and video game industries are fun-loving enough to participate in this tradition every year. Here are some of 2022's highlights:   Made in Abyss  Made in Abyss's Prushka takes the directorial seat in a visual parodying Indiana Jones movie posters.    [Link]   Love Live!    The Love Live! franchise teased "Genjitsu no Yohane -Sunshine in the Mirror-", a new anime featuring the chuunibyou-afflicted idol Yohane as a magical girl, apparently slated for 2023. G's Magazine's Love Live! Days magazine is serializing illustrations and a comic.   Shadows House    Shadows House teases a "live-action film" (featuring puppets) with a 7-minute preview.    [Link]   Kaguya-sama: Love is War  The series released a "hidden side" visual for the Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai -Ultra Romantic- depicting the Four Ramen Emperors of Tokyo.    [Link]   The Angel Next Door Spoils Me Rotten  She can be your angel or your devil... The series releases an alternate version of the anime's key visual showing heroine Mahiru in her "little devil" form.    [Link]   Trapped in a Dating Sim: The World of Otome Games is Tough for Mobs    The anime released a promotional video for Alto Liebe, the fictional otome game the story is set in. The PV previews the handsome male love interests Julius Rapha Holfort, Jilk Fia Marmoria, Brad Fou Field, Chris Fia Arclight, and Greg Fou Seberg. The video also previews voice actors' Kenichi Suzumura, Kousuke Toriumi, Shinnosuke Tachibana, Koji Yusa, and Nobuyuki Hiyama's theme song "Supreme Love Star." The song will release on music streaming services on April 10.    [Link]   A Couple of Cuckoos  The anime releases a "cat" version of its main visual.    [Link]   Teasing Master Takagi  The series launched a free online puzzle game, titled "Nishikata Quest Online." By clearing the game, you can re-experience the TV anime's final episode.    [Link]   Azur Lane   戦い（バトル）の舞台は、青い海ではなく、暗い宇宙（そら）へ－－『　#アズールレーン　』 pic.twitter.com/fcFonIvOVZ— アズールレーン公式 (@azurlane_staff) March 31, 2022     The strategy game reimagines itself as a Super Robot War-style battle RPG with a teaser video.   BanG Dream!   ＼🌸Girl's Blossom Project🌸／ 〜 #嘘のようなホントの恋💖〜ガルパの恋愛シミュレーションゲームが、ついにリリースされました✨ぜひ、今作をお楽しみください💫満開の桜の樹の下……私はあなたと――ホントの恋に落ちる👇💕https://t.co/ugR4zNWHIG#バンドリ #ガルパ #ガルブロ— バンドリ！ ガールズバンドパーティ！ (@bang_dream_gbp) March 31, 2022     The music rhythm game released a short playable spinoff game on its website reimagining itself as a romance visual novel.   Tensei Kenja no Isekai Life  Protagonist Yuji gains another class to become the strongest—not as a sage but as a buff bodybuilder.    [Link]   Nekopara  Neko Works announces a dog version of the catgirl-themed visual novel series, titled Inupara: Dogs Paradise. Inupara stars six different dog girls each representing a popular breed. The game's protagonist is a college student who shuns the usual social life in favor of spending quality time with his two dogs. One day, he wakes up to find his faithful pooches transformed into girls.     #INUPARA pic.twitter.com/xtxuYTKBhx— NEKO WORKs/NEKOPARA Official (@nekopara_pr) March 31, 2022     The hypothetical game's opening video is streaming on YouTube and includes the theme song "Inu no Ōta" by singer Nanahira.      Don't Hurt Me, My Healer! & Healer Girl   The two healer-themed anime released a crossover visual.    Masamune-kun's Revenge The Masamune-kun's Revenge anime released a comic strip jokingly announcing a "season 3." In the illustration, Yoshino Koiwai is shown reaching for a sign reading "Season 3 production confirmed," while Aki Adagaki points out: "What are you doing? Before you can announce season 3, you have to announce season 2! Take that down!"          discuss this in the forum (11 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                Interest homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More          ⬈ ⬋ - +                            feature          74 comments       The Spring 2022 Preview Guide   Apr  4, 01:29 74 comments                 anime    The thrilling conclusion of Magia Record is live! Interest Anime/Manga/Game Industry Celebrates April Fool's Day 2022   posted on 2022-04-02 00:45 UTC-8 by Kim Morrissy         Roundup of joke announcements from Made in Abyss, Love Live!, Shadows House, Kaguya-sama, more    It's that time of the year again: the cherry blossoms fall, and the April Fool's pranks fly. Japan's anime, manga and video game industries are fun-loving enough to participate in this tradition every year. Here are some of 2022's highlights:   Made in Abyss  Made in Abyss's Prushka takes the directorial seat in a visual parodying Indiana Jones movie posters.    [Link]   Love Live!    The Love Live! franchise teased "Genjitsu no Yohane -Sunshine in the Mirror-", a new anime featuring the chuunibyou-afflicted idol Yohane as a magical girl, apparently slated for 2023. G's Magazine's Love Live! Days magazine is serializing illustrations and a comic.   Shadows House    Shadows House teases a "live-action film" (featuring puppets) with a 7-minute preview.    [Link]   Kaguya-sama: Love is War  The series released a "hidden side" visual for the Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai -Ultra Romantic- depicting the Four Ramen Emperors of Tokyo.    [Link]   The Angel Next Door Spoils Me Rotten  She can be your angel or your devil... The series releases an alternate version of the anime's key visual showing heroine Mahiru in her "little devil" form.    [Link]   Trapped in a Dating Sim: The World of Otome Games is Tough for Mobs    The anime released a promotional video for Alto Liebe, the fictional otome game the story is set in. The PV previews the handsome male love interests Julius Rapha Holfort, Jilk Fia Marmoria, Brad Fou Field, Chris Fia Arclight, and Greg Fou Seberg. The video also previews voice actors' Kenichi Suzumura, Kousuke Toriumi, Shinnosuke Tachibana, Koji Yusa, and Nobuyuki Hiyama's theme song "Supreme Love Star." The song will release on music streaming services on April 10.    [Link]   A Couple of Cuckoos  The anime releases a "cat" version of its main visual.    [Link]   Teasing Master Takagi  The series launched a free online puzzle game, titled "Nishikata Quest Online." By clearing the game, you can re-experience the TV anime's final episode.    [Link]   Azur Lane   戦い（バトル）の舞台は、青い海ではなく、暗い宇宙（そら）へ－－『　#アズールレーン　』 pic.twitter.com/fcFonIvOVZ— アズールレーン公式 (@azurlane_staff) March 31, 2022     The strategy game reimagines itself as a Super Robot War-style battle RPG with a teaser video.   BanG Dream!   ＼🌸Girl's Blossom Project🌸／ 〜 #嘘のようなホントの恋💖〜ガルパの恋愛シミュレーションゲームが、ついにリリースされました✨ぜひ、今作をお楽しみください💫満開の桜の樹の下……私はあなたと――ホントの恋に落ちる👇💕https://t.co/ugR4zNWHIG#バンドリ #ガルパ #ガルブロ— バンドリ！ ガールズバンドパーティ！ (@bang_dream_gbp) March 31, 2022     The music rhythm game released a short playable spinoff game on its website reimagining itself as a romance visual novel.   Tensei Kenja no Isekai Life  Protagonist Yuji gains another class to become the strongest—not as a sage but as a buff bodybuilder.    [Link]   Nekopara  Neko Works announces a dog version of the catgirl-themed visual novel series, titled Inupara: Dogs Paradise. Inupara stars six different dog girls each representing a popular breed. The game's protagonist is a college student who shuns the usual social life in favor of spending quality time with his two dogs. One day, he wakes up to find his faithful pooches transformed into girls.     #INUPARA pic.twitter.com/xtxuYTKBhx— NEKO WORKs/NEKOPARA Official (@nekopara_pr) March 31, 2022     The hypothetical game's opening video is streaming on YouTube and includes the theme song "Inu no Ōta" by singer Nanahira.      Don't Hurt Me, My Healer! & Healer Girl   The two healer-themed anime released a crossover visual.    Masamune-kun's Revenge The Masamune-kun's Revenge anime released a comic strip jokingly announcing a "season 3." In the illustration, Yoshino Koiwai is shown reaching for a sign reading "Season 3 production confirmed," while Aki Adagaki points out: "What are you doing? Before you can announce season 3, you have to announce season 2! Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             Interest Anime/Manga/Game Industry Celebrates April Fool's Day 2022   posted on 2022-04-02 00:45 UTC-8 by Kim Morrissy         Roundup of joke announcements from Made in Abyss, Love Live!, Shadows House, Kaguya-sama, more    It's that time of the year again: the cherry blossoms fall, and the April Fool's pranks fly. Japan's anime, manga and video game industries are fun-loving enough to participate in this tradition every year. Here are some of 2022's highlights:   Made in Abyss  Made in Abyss's Prushka takes the directorial seat in a visual parodying Indiana Jones movie posters.    [Link]   Love Live!    The Love Live! franchise teased "Genjitsu no Yohane -Sunshine in the Mirror-", a new anime featuring the chuunibyou-afflicted idol Yohane as a magical girl, apparently slated for 2023. G's Magazine's Love Live! Days magazine is serializing illustrations and a comic.   Shadows House    Shadows House teases a "live-action film" (featuring puppets) with a 7-minute preview.    [Link]   Kaguya-sama: Love is War  The series released a "hidden side" visual for the Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai -Ultra Romantic- depicting the Four Ramen Emperors of Tokyo.    [Link]   The Angel Next Door Spoils Me Rotten  She can be your angel or your devil... The series releases an alternate version of the anime's key visual showing heroine Mahiru in her "little devil" form.    [Link]   Trapped in a Dating Sim: The World of Otome Games is Tough for Mobs    The anime released a promotional video for Alto Liebe, the fictional otome game the story is set in. The PV previews the handsome male love interests Julius Rapha Holfort, Jilk Fia Marmoria, Brad Fou Field, Chris Fia Arclight, and Greg Fou Seberg. The video also previews voice actors' Kenichi Suzumura, Kousuke Toriumi, Shinnosuke Tachibana, Koji Yusa, and Nobuyuki Hiyama's theme song "Supreme Love Star." The song will release on music streaming services on April 10.    [Link]   A Couple of Cuckoos  The anime releases a "cat" version of its main visual.    [Link]   Teasing Master Takagi  The series launched a free online puzzle game, titled "Nishikata Quest Online." By clearing the game, you can re-experience the TV anime's final episode.    [Link]   Azur Lane   戦い（バトル）の舞台は、青い海ではなく、暗い宇宙（そら）へ－－『　#アズールレーン　』 pic.twitter.com/fcFonIvOVZ— アズールレーン公式 (@azurlane_staff) March 31, 2022     The strategy game reimagines itself as a Super Robot War-style battle RPG with a teaser video.   BanG Dream!   ＼🌸Girl's Blossom Project🌸／ 〜 #嘘のようなホントの恋💖〜ガルパの恋愛シミュレーションゲームが、ついにリリースされました✨ぜひ、今作をお楽しみください💫満開の桜の樹の下……私はあなたと――ホントの恋に落ちる👇💕https://t.co/ugR4zNWHIG#バンドリ #ガルパ #ガルブロ— バンドリ！ ガールズバンドパーティ！ (@bang_dream_gbp) March 31, 2022     The music rhythm game released a short playable spinoff game on its website reimagining itself as a romance visual novel.   Tensei Kenja no Isekai Life  Protagonist Yuji gains another class to become the strongest—not as a sage but as a buff bodybuilder.    [Link]   Nekopara  Neko Works announces a dog version of the catgirl-themed visual novel series, titled Inupara: Dogs Paradise. Inupara stars six different dog girls each representing a popular breed. The game's protagonist is a college student who shuns the usual social life in favor of spending quality time with his two dogs. One day, he wakes up to find his faithful pooches transformed into girls.     #INUPARA pic.twitter.com/xtxuYTKBhx— NEKO WORKs/NEKOPARA Official (@nekopara_pr) March 31, 2022     The hypothetical game's opening video is streaming on YouTube and includes the theme song "Inu no Ōta" by singer Nanahira.      Don't Hurt Me, My Healer! & Healer Girl   The two healer-themed anime released a crossover visual.    Masamune-kun's Revenge The Masamune-kun's Revenge anime released a comic strip jokingly announcing a "season 3." In the illustration, Yoshino Koiwai is shown reaching for a sign reading "Season 3 production confirmed," while Aki Adagaki points out: "What are you doing? Before you can announce season 3, you have to announce season 2! [Link]   Teasing Master Takagi  The series launched a free online puzzle game, titled "Nishikata Quest Online." By clearing the game, you can re-experience the TV anime's final episode.    [Link]   Azur Lane   戦い（バトル）の舞台は、青い海ではなく、暗い宇宙（そら）へ－－『　#アズールレーン　』 pic.twitter.com/fcFonIvOVZ— アズールレーン公式 (@azurlane_staff) March 31, 2022     The strategy game reimagines itself as a Super Robot War-style battle RPG with a teaser video.   BanG Dream!   ＼🌸Girl's Blossom Project🌸／ 〜 #嘘のようなホントの恋💖〜ガルパの恋愛シミュレーションゲームが、ついにリリースされました✨ぜひ、今作をお楽しみください💫満開の桜の樹の下……私はあなたと――ホントの恋に落ちる👇💕https://t.co/ugR4zNWHIG#バンドリ #ガルパ #ガルブロ— バンドリ！ ガールズバンドパーティ！ (@bang_dream_gbp) March 31, 2022     The music rhythm game released a short playable spinoff game on its website reimagining itself as a romance visual novel.   Tensei Kenja no Isekai Life  Protagonist Yuji gains another class to become the strongest—not as a sage but as a buff bodybuilder.    [Link]   Nekopara  Neko Works announces a dog version of the catgirl-themed visual novel series, titled Inupara: Dogs Paradise. Inupara stars six different dog girls each representing a popular breed. The game's protagonist is a college student who shuns the usual social life in favor of spending quality time with his two dogs. One day, he wakes up to find his faithful pooches transformed into girls.     #INUPARA pic.twitter.com/xtxuYTKBhx— NEKO WORKs/NEKOPARA Official (@nekopara_pr) March 31, 2022     The hypothetical game's opening video is streaming on YouTube and includes the theme song "Inu no Ōta" by singer Nanahira.      Don't Hurt Me, My Healer! & Healer Girl   The two healer-themed anime released a crossover visual.    Masamune-kun's Revenge The Masamune-kun's Revenge anime released a comic strip jokingly announcing a "season 3." In the illustration, Yoshino Koiwai is shown reaching for a sign reading "Season 3 production confirmed," while Aki Adagaki points out: "What are you doing? Before you can announce season 3, you have to announce season 2! Take that down!"          discuss this in the forum (11 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                Interest homepage / archives

Data: ⬈ ⬋ - +                            feature          74 comments       The Spring 2022 Preview Guide   Apr  4, 01:29 74 comments                 anime    The thrilling conclusion of Magia Record is live! ANN's preview guide is updating daily with new reviews including Trapped in a Dating Sim, Fanfare of Adolescence, Love Live Nijigasaki,  The Executioner and Her Way of Life, Science Fell in Love, Ya Boy, Kongming!, Legend of Galactic Heroes, and more! ― Adblock+ breaks this page, consider whitelisting ANN Welcome to Anime News Network's Spring 2022 Pre...                    news          55 comments       Attack on Titan The Final Season Anime's 'Conclusion' to Air in 2023   Apr  4, 00:27 55 comments                 anime    Part 3 announced after end of Part 2 on Monday ― The Attack on Titan The Final Season Part 2 anime ended on Monday with an announcement that the Attack on Titan The Final Season's "conclusion" will air on the NHK-General channel in 2023. The teaser's English description calls the next part "Part 3," but the Japanese text calls it "kanketsu-hen" (conclusion). The season's Part 2 premiered with episode...                    news          8 comments       Made in Abyss Anime Season 2 Unveils July Premiere, New Visual   Apr  4, 00:25 8 comments                 anime    The Golden City of the Scorching Sun season casts Misaki Kuno, Yuka Terasaki, Hiroaki Hirata, Mitsuki Saiga ― The staff for Made in Abyss: Retsujitsu no Ōgonkyō (Made in Abyss: The Golden City of the Scorching Sun), the second television anime season based on Akihito Tsukushi's Made in Abyss manga, posted the anime's July premiere and a new visual on Saturday. The three main cast members are returnin...                    news          5 comments       The [email protected] Cinderella Girls U149 Manga Gets TV Anime   Apr  4, 00:23 5 comments                 anime    Kyowno's story of idols under 149 centimeters tall & their producer ― The final concert in "The [email protected] Cinderella Girls 10th Anniversary [email protected] Wonderland!!!" tour ended on Sunday with an announcement that Kyowno's The Id[email protected] Cinderella Girls U149 manga is launching a television anime adaptation by the studio Cygames Pictures. 【シンデレラ】「アイドルマスター シンデレラガールズ U149」TVアニメ化プロジェクト始動！！シンデレラガールズ10周年記念ツア...                    news                Tsukiuta Multimedia Idol Project Gets Anime Feature Movie in 2023   Apr  4, 00:20                 anime    Rabbits Kingdom the Movie to adapt 5th stage production for 10th anniversary ― The final performance of the 12th Tsukiuta. stage production ended on Sunday with an announcement of a Tsukiuta. anime feature film. Rabbits Kingdom the Movie will open next year (the 10th anniversary of the franchise and the Year of the Rabbit on the lunar calendar) as an adaptation of the fifth stage production.
